decks.notes: The primary objective of this deck is to maintain control over the game through disruption and removal spells, while also generating card advantage through card draw and manipulation effects. By using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card selection, the player aims to out value their opponent and steadily advance their own game plan. The inclusion of win conditions like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Psychic Frog ensures the deck has a way to close out the game once it has gained control.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Shifting Woodland card in conjunction with various other cards to create a powerful combo strategy. By ramping up mana with Utopia Sprawl and Explore, the deck aims to quickly play powerful spells like Emrakul, the Promised End and Malevolent Rumble. Cards like Kozilek's Command and Lumra, Bellow of the Woods provide control and disruption, while Aftermath Analyst and Icetill Explorer offer card draw and creature support. The deck also includes land destruction and graveyard interaction to further disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It includes a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and creatures that can quickly close out the game. The deck also features cards that disrupt the opponent's graveyard and provide card advantage. By efficiently using a mix of control elements and aggressive threats, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a fast-paced Modern format.

This deck revolves around quickly playing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, and using cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth to deal damage quickly. It also utilizes Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration for card advantage and to filter draws. The land base is focused on getting the right colors of mana quickly to support the aggressive plays. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain that pressure until victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and control the board. Utilizing a mix of powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, along with instant removal like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact further enhance the deck's control elements, making it a strong choice for players looking to dominate the early game and maintain momentum throughout the match.

This deck focuses on using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand into play from the graveyard. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo. Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog provide additional card advantage while cards like Solitude and Subtlety offer protection and removal spells. The goal of the deck is to quickly reanimate powerful creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while quickly building up a board presence and controlling the game. It utilizes powerful creatures like Quantum Riddler and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, along with control elements like Solitude and Thoughtseize. The deck also includes flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to re-use powerful enters-the-battlefield abilities. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive elements, this deck aims to outmaneuver and overwhelm the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using powerful Eldrazi creatures and powerful colorless spells, while utilizing the UrzaTron lands to generate massive amounts of mana. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Kozilek's Command, while also ramping up to play big threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. The deck also includes cards like Expedition Map to help find the UrzaTron lands quickly and efficiently.

This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes a variety of efficient removal spells like Prismatic Ending and board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Wrath of the Skies to maintain board control. The inclusion of companions such as Kaheera, the Orphanguard provides additional value and synergies with the deck's overall game plan. The deck's strategic core lies in disrupting the opponent's plans while slowly building up advantage to ultimately outvalue and outlast the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine) to generate large amounts of mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths. It also includes a suite of control elements like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Dismember and Kozilek's Command while ramping into big threats and ultimately overwhelming the opponent with its powerful late-game plays.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through a mix of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. The deck aims to maintain board control while manipulating the opponent's hand and deck with cards like Thoughtseize and Strategic Betrayal. Kaito, Bane of Nightmares serves as a win condition by punishing opponents for having an empty hand, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Quantum Riddler provide card advantage and manipulation. The deck's land base allows for flexibility in casting spells while maintaining a consistent mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, using cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour. Once these creatures are in the graveyard, the deck utilizes cards like Unearth and Persist to bring them back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo that can overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game and protect the combo. The key strategy is to reanimate big threats and quickly close out the game.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plans through a combination of countermagic, hand disruption, and removal spells. By controlling the game with cards like Force of Negation, Thoughtseize, and Fatal Push, the deck aims to maintain board presence with creatures like Murktide Regent and Abhorrent Oculus. Utilizing a mixture of lands to fix mana and draw cards, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition. The inclusion of cards like Cling to Dust and Thought Scour also provide additional utility and card advantage.

The deck focuses on using various instant spells like Ephemerate and Force of Negation to protect key combo pieces like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand. By using Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence, the deck can quickly reanimate powerful creatures from the graveyard like Griselbrand. The deck also includes cards like Subtlety and Prismatic Ending for removal and disruption. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while controlling the game with countermagic and removal spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls to provide support and buffs to the creatures. Additionally, cards like Goblin Bombardment and Sundering Eruption offer additional removal and reach. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent stream of threats while also being able to deal with opposing threats efficiently.

The deck focuses on using a combination of instant and sorcery spells to control the board while building up resources to use Goblin Charbelcher as a win condition. By utilizing cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention to ramp up mana, the deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary components to activate Goblin Charbelcher's ability and deal lethal damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck lacks traditional land cards and instead relies on non-land sources of mana to power its combo strategy.
